sen.j: 住吉造（すみよしづくり）は、日本の神社建築の1つである。
sen.e: Sumiyoshi-zukuri style is one of the architectural styles of shrines in Japan.
Sumiyoshi-zukuri style is one of the architectural styles of shrines in Japan.
Sumiyoshi-zukuri style is one of the architectural styles of shrines in Japan.

sen.j: 住吉大社に代表される住吉造の特徴として、破風は古式の直線形であり、大嘗祭の際に造られる建物と似ていることが指摘されている。
sen.e: Sumiyoshi-zukuri style, which is typified by Sumiyoshi-taisha Shrine, is characterized by its ancient linear hafu (a barge board), and its resemblance to the building constructed in Daijo-sai festival (a festival to celebrate the succession of an emperor) has been pointed out.

Sumiyoshi-zukuri style, which is typified by Sumiyoshi-taisha Shrine, is characterized by its ancient linear hafu (a barge board), and many have pointed out its resemblance to the building constructed in the Daijo-sai festival (a festival to celebrate the succession of an emperor).

Sumiyoshi-zukuri style, which is typified by Sumiyoshi-taisha Shrine, is characterized by its ancient linear hafu (a barge board), and many have pointed out its resemblance to the building constructed in the Daijo-sai festival (a festival to celebrate the succession of an emperor).

sen.j: 伊勢神宮に代表される神明造や出雲大社に代表される大社造と共に、神社建築の最古の様式とされる。
sen.e: It is one of the oldest architectural styles of shrines along with shinmei-zukuri style, which is exemplified by Ise-jingu Shrine, and taisha-zukuri style, which is epitomized by Izumo-taisha Shrine.

It is one of the oldest architectural styles of shrines, along with shinmei-zukuri style, which is exemplified by Ise-jingu Shrine, and taisha-zukuri style, which is epitomized by Izumo-taisha Shrine.

It is one of the oldest architectural styles of shrines, along with shinmei-zukuri style, which is exemplified by Ise-jingu Shrine, and taisha-zukuri style, which is epitomized by Izumo-taisha Shrine.

sen.j: 回縁と御心柱はなく、内部は内陣・外陣に区切られる。
sen.e: Sumiyoshi-zukuri style architecture has no veranda (a narrow wooden passageway along the edge of a house facing the garden) or the sacred core pillar installed at the center of the main sanctuary of a shrine, and the inside is divided into naijin (inner sanctuary of a shrine or temple) and gejin (part of the main sanctuary outside the innermost sanctum of a shrine).

Sumiyoshi-zukuri style architecture has no veranda (a narrow wooden passageway along the edge of a house facing the garden) or the sacred core pillar installed at the center of the main sanctuary of a shrine, and the inside is divided into a naijin (inner sanctuary of a shrine or temple) and a gejin (part of the main sanctuary outside the innermost sanctum of a shrine).

Sumiyoshi-zukuri style architecture has no veranda (a narrow wooden passageway along the edge of a house facing the garden) or the sacred core pillar installed at the center of the main sanctuary of a shrine, and the inside is divided into a naijin (inner sanctuary of a shrine or temple) and a gejin (part of the main sanctuary outside the innermost sanctum of a shrine).

sen.j: 幅は2間だが、奥行きは内陣・外陣各2間の長方形である。
sen.e: It is rectangular with a width of approx. 3.6 meters and a depth of approx. 7.3 meters, approx. 3.6 meters for naijin and gejin each.
It is rectangular with a width of approx. 3.6 meters and a depth of approx. 7.3 meters, approx. 3.6 meters each for the naijin and gejin.
It is rectangular with a width of approx. 3.6 meters and a depth of approx. 7.3 meters, approx. 3.6 meters each for the naijin and gejin.

sen.j: 切妻造・妻入であり、平面的に加工され直線的な外観となる。
sen.e: The structure of sumiyoshi-zukuri style employs kirizuma-zukuri style (an architectural style with a gabled roof) with Tsuma-iri (entrance on gable side), and its planar working gives a linear outlook.

The structure of sumiyoshi-zukuri style employs kirizuma-zukuri style (an architectural style with a gabled roof) with a Tsuma-iri (entrance on the gable side), and its planar working gives a linear outlook.

The structure of sumiyoshi-zukuri style employs kirizuma-zukuri style (an architectural style with a gabled roof) with a Tsuma-iri (entrance on the gable side), and its planar working gives a linear outlook.

sen.j: 萱葺に限らず柿葺や檜皮葺など幅広い。
sen.e: The roofs are not necessarily thatched; there are wide varieties, from kokerabuki (a roof covering made with a layer of thin wooden shingles made of cypress) to hiwadabuki (cypress bark roof).
The roofs are not necessarily thatched; there are wide varieties, from kokerabuki (a roof covering made with a layer of thin wooden shingles made of cypress) to hiwadabuki (cypress bark roof).
The roofs are not necessarily thatched; there are wide varieties, from kokerabuki (a roof covering made with a layer of thin wooden shingles made of cypress) to hiwadabuki (cypress bark roof).

sen.j: 住吉大社の破風は直線形、妻飾りは交叉合掌型となっている。
sen.e: The hafu of Sumiyoshi-taisha Shrine is linear-shaped, and the embellishment of gable pediments is 交叉合掌型.
sen.cmt: 「交叉合掌型」は読みおよび定訳が不明です。
sen.e: The hafu of Sumiyoshi-taisha Shrine is linear-shaped, and the embellishment of gable pediments is 交叉合掌型.
The hafu of Sumiyoshi-taisha Shrine is linear-shaped, and the embellishment of gable pediments is 交叉合掌型.
Pillars
Pillars
Pillars

sen.j: 幅は2間で、奥行き4間、中央の御心柱と正面中央の柱がない。
sen.e: The architecture is approx. 3.6 meters wide and approx. 7.3 meters deep without the sacred core pillar installed at the center of the main sanctuary of a shrine, or pillars at the center on the front.

The architecture is approx. 3.6 meters wide and approx. 7.3 meters deep without the sacred core pillar installed at the center of the main sanctuary of a shrine, or pillars at the center on the front.

The architecture is approx. 3.6 meters wide and approx. 7.3 meters deep without the sacred core pillar installed at the center of the main sanctuary of a shrine, or pillars at the center on the front.
Walls
Walls
Walls

sen.j: 正面中央の1か所に観音開きの御扉による開口部が設けられる。
sen.e: A double-door opening is provided in one place at the center on the front.
A double-door opening is provided at one location, at the center on the front.
A double-door opening is provided at one location, at the center on the front.
Floors
Floors
Floors

sen.j: 大社造や神明造に比べて、床は低い。
sen.e: The floor is lower than that of taisha-zukuri style and shinmei-zukuri style.
The floor is lower than those of taisha-zukuri style and shinmei-zukuri style.
